text: General elections were held in Montserrat on 20 February 1952.General Election Results - 20 February 1952 Caribbean Elections They were the first elections in Montserrat held under universal suffrage, which had been introduced the previous year.Past Election Results 1952 - 2009 Caribbean Elections The result was a victory for the Montserrat Labour Party, which won all five seats in the Legislative Council. ==Campaign== A total of 11 candidates contested the elections, with the MLP running a full slate of candidates and the Merchant Planters putting forward four. As a result, Michael Walkinshaw was elected unopposed in the Central constituency.Howard A Fergus (1985) Rule Britannia: Politics in British Montserrat, University Centre, p96 ==Results== {| class=wikitable style=text-align:right !Party !Votes !% !Seats |- |align=left|Montserrat Labour Party||2,033||69.4||5 |- |align=left|Merchant Planters||893||30.6||0 |- |align=left|Invalid/blank votes||88||–||– |- |align=left|Total||3,014||100||5 |- |align=left|Registered voters/turnout||3,019||99.8||– |- |align=left colspan=4|Source: EmmanuelPatrick A Emmanuel (1992) Elections & Party Systems in the Commonwealth Caribbean 1944-1991, Caribbean Development Research Service, pp10–24 |} ===Elected MPs=== {| class=wikitable style=text-align:left !Constituency !Elected MP !Party |- |Central||Michael Walkinshaw||Montserrat Labour Party |- |Northern||Edward Theophilus Edgecombe||Montserrat Labour Party |- |Plymouth||Robert William Griffith||Montserrat Labour Party |- |Southern||Brunel Wycliffe Edwards||Montserrat Labour Party |- |Windward||William Henry Bramble||Montserrat Labour Party |} ==References== 1952 Category:1952 elections in the Caribbean Category:1952 in Montserrat Category:February 1952 events
title: 1952 Montserratian general election
